discourse_list.title: Robinhood to launch a stand-alone application that lets users custody their own NFTs and cryptocurrencies

content.content: Robinhood is going for it and will be battling Coinbase and others. I’m looking forward to seeing how this turns out.    TechCrunch    Robinhood lets users manage their own crypto wallets in push to spur trading... Amid falling trading volumes, Robinhood adds another crypto product to its platform -- noncustodial wallets      Apparently the wallet will let users “trade and swap crypto with no network fees,” access DeFi services and store NFTs. It’s not clear for now how exactly Robinhood will be able to navigate around the high gas fees but at least part of Robinhood’s solution as to keeping gas fees down will entail “partnering with liquidity partners to get the best price.”

MFeinberg:  “partnering with liquidity partners to get the best price.”   im skeptical of the whole thing due to robinhoods gamestop fiasco. but assuming the liquidity providers are venture capitalists, i’m curious on what would robinhood offer a firm that will incentivize them to take on those gas fees?
